title: Key GOP senators call out Mitch McConnell
description: Sen. Mitch McConnell (R-KY) is facing push back from members of his own party after he agreed to a deal with Democrats to extend the debt ceiling until December.

title: Reality Check: Inside America's 'militias' - from the KKK to the Oath Keepers
description: America's self-styled militias have roots dating back to the KKK's formation during Reconstruction. In the latest "Reality Check with John Avlon: Extremist Beat," CNN's Sara Sidner joins Avlon as they trace this history, from the Minutemen of the 1960's to the deadly Oklahoma City bombing to today's Oath Keepers.

title: UAE becomes first Gulf state to commit to net zero. Oil will still flow
description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has become the first country in the Persian Gulf to commit to net zero carbon emissions by 2050. But it's not turning its back on oil just yet.

title: Uber faces legal action in UK over racial discrimination claims
description: Uber is facing legal action over its use of facial recognition software that allegedly discriminates against people of color.

title: Mussolini's granddaughter tops polls in Rome council vote
description: Rachele Mussolini, granddaughter of the Italian fascist leader Benito Mussolini, won the highest number of votes in Rome's city council elections, official results showed Wednesday.

title: Saudi Arabian-backed consortium agrees Newcastle United takeover
description: A Saudi Arabian-backed takeover of Premier League club Newcastle United has been agreed, the Premier League announced on Thursday.

title: Levi's says casual comfort is our new normal, and it's here to stay
description: Levi's says it could take a while before consumers are ready to toss aside a pair of comfy baggy jeans for dressier clothing.

title: US warns it could sanction Ethiopia after CNN reveals airline ferried weapons during Tigray war
description: The Biden administration has described a CNN report that Ethiopian Airlines shuttled weapons to Eritrea as "incredibly grave" and warned that it was prepared to impose sanctions on Ethiopia and any other parties who prolonged the conflict in Tigray.

title: Dow rallies 500 points as market volatility continues
description: There's no end in sight to the volatility on Wall Street as US stocks rallied again Thursday morning.

title: 'The Masked Singer' reveals who's behind Baby
description: "The Masked Singer" pulled the cover off of the celebrity who's been inside a baby costume this season.

title: Schumer announces deal to extend debt ceiling through early December
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer announced Thursday morning that a deal has been reached for an extension of the nation's debt ceiling through early December, a major breakthrough to avert economic disaster that comes after weeks of partisan deadlock over how to resolve the issue.

title: Tim McGraw shares story about proposing to Faith Hill
description: Country singer Tim McGraw tells fans the story of how fellow country star Faith Hill accepted his marriage proposal in honor of their 25th wedding anniversary.

title: Magnitude 5.9 earthquake rocks Japan's northwestern Chiba prefecture
description: An earthquake of 6.1 magnitude struck Japan's northwestern Chiba Prefecture, which lies east of the capital Tokyo, on Thursday evening, according to Japan Meteorological Agency.

title: A global energy crisis is coming. There's no quick fix
Kim Kardashian preparing for 'SNL' hosting debut
description: Kim Kardashian is just days away from her hosting debut on "Saturday Night Live."

title: Time Out picks the 'world's coolest' neighborhood for 2021
description: The top 10 includes the foodie hub of Leith in Edinburgh, Scotland and artsy Station District in Vilnius, Lithuania, but which neighborhood is the hippest hangout in Time Out's round-up?

title: Rare 16th century Italian dish discovered in a drawer sells for $1.7 million
description: An "incredibly rare" 16th century dish depicting the biblical tale of Samson and Delilah which was discovered tucked away in a drawer has sold at auction for more than $1.7 million -- 10 times its original estimate.

title: Abdulrazak Gurnah wins Nobel Prize for literature
description: The Nobel Prize for literature has been awarded to the novelist Abdulrazak Gurnah, "for his uncompromising and compassionate penetration of the effects of colonialism and the fate of the refugee in the gulf between cultures and continents."

title: Pegasus spyware maker ends contract with UAE after UK high court's hacking ruling
description: The Israeli manufacturer of Pegasus spyware said Thursday it had terminated its contract with the United Arab Emirates (UAE) in the wake of a ruling by England's high court that Dubai's ruler hacked his ex-wife's phone using the software.

title: Studies confirm waning immunity from Pfizer's Covid-19 vaccine
India to allow tourists for first time in 18 months
description: India is to begin granting tourist visas for foreign visitors after an 18-month pause due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the country's government announced Thursday.

title: At least 15 killed after 5.9-magnitude earthquake hits southwestern Pakistan
description: At least 20 people were killed and nearly 200 injured after a 5.7 magnitude earthquake hit southwestern Pakistan in the early hours of Thursday, according to welfare organization the Edhi Foundation.

title: Netflix edits 'Squid Game' after woman bombarded with prank calls
description: Netflix has said it will edit scenes featuring a phone number in the smash hit show "Squid Game" after a woman in South Korea said she was inundated with thousands of calls and texts.

title: Andrew Lloyd Webber bought a dog because 'Cats' was so bad
description: Andrew Lloyd Webber says he now has a therapy dog, thanks, in part, to the trauma of the "Cats" movie.

title: Russian state-backed hackers having greater success at breaching foreign government targets, Microsoft says
description: Russian state-backed hackers are having greater success at breaching targets in the United States and elsewhere as they make government organizations the primary focus of their attacks, according to data that Microsoft released Thursday.

title: India's $99 billion man is opening the country's first 7-Eleven
description: India's richest man is bringing 7-Eleven to the country, adding the convenience store chain to a sprawling business empire that spans energy, chemicals, retail and telecommunications.

title: 100-year-old goes on trial in Germany accused of 3,518 Nazi war crimes
description: The trial of a 100-year-old former SS guard starts Thursday in the German town of Brandenburg an der Havel.

title: CIA will focus on China with new mission center
description: The CIA announced a number of structural changes on Thursday, including a new mission center for China, the result of a months-long review and a reflection of the intelligence community's view of China as the greatest long-term threat to the United States.

title: Facebook whistleblower to talk to January 6 committee
Cathie Wood's Ark Invest is quitting Wall Street and moving to Florida
description: Cathie Wood is moving her business to Florida.

title: See how this dog is taking over public transport in Istanbul
description: A stray street dog in Istanbul, Turkey, has been seen traveling on public transport for several months. CNN's Rosemary Church has more.

title: Meet this year's winner of Alaska's 'Fat Bear Week'
description: Weighing over 1000 pounds, a brown bear named '480 Otis' has been crowned winner of Fat Bear Week 2021 in Alaska. CNN's Rosemary Church has more.

title: Hong Kong developer quits the stock market as Evergrande fallout spreads
description: Chinese Estates Holdings plans to go private after its stock was slammed by fallout from the crisis at Evergrande.

title: America's wasted billions in Afghanistan. Here are 10 of the starkest examples
description: Half a billion dollars of aircraft that flew for about a year. A huge $85 million hotel that never opened, and sits in disrepair. Camouflage uniforms for the Afghan army whose fancy pattern would cost an extra $28 million. A healthcare facility listed as located in the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Footballers are playing an 'obscene' amount of games. Will a World Cup every two years make it worse?
description: Not long after his transfer from Sporting to Manchester United, it quickly became apparent that Bruno Fernandes was the Premier League club's most influential player.

title: Aerial footage shows damage in Amazon rainforest
description: The Amazon rainforest is at severe risk from deforestation and fires that are eroding the forest's ability to absorb heat-trapping greenhouse gas that contributes to global warming. Even worse, the fires themselves are releasing carbon and adding to the problem. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: Tyson Fury promises to knockout Deontay Wilder in heated press conference ahead of trilogy fight
description: A furious Tyson Fury vowed to knockout Deontay Wilder when the two rivals meet for the third time on Saturday in Las Vegas with the Briton's WBC heavyweight title on the line.

title: Nearly three feet of rain fell in Italy in only half a day
description: Extreme, climate-fueled rainfall broke records this week in a part of Italy known for its rain and an area in Oman not known for rain at all.

title: What experts say about the best time to exercise
description: For everyone who hates setting their alarm an hour earlier to hit the gym, scientists may have some good news.

title: Pregnant doctor dies from Covid after replacing coworkers on front line
description: Indonesia's healthcare workers bore the brunt of a deadly second wave of coronavirus as a record number of doctors succumbed to the virus. CNN's Paula Hancocks takes a look at the toll a highly virulent Delta variant took on the country's frontline workers.

title: This is a teenager's brain on Instagram
description: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen says Instagram can lead young people down a negative spiral -- one they are ill-equipped to get out of. Experts say that's because the adolescent brain is still developing and the excessive social media use could have long-term consequences. CNN's Clare Sebastian reports.

title: Qantas repatriation flight sets aviation record
description: Australian airline Qantas has set a company record by flying a one-off direct flight from Buenos Aires to the city of Darwin in Australia's Northern Territory.

title: Stacey Abrams responds to Trump invoking her name
description: Democrat Stacey Abrams responds to former President Donald Trump invoking her name at a recent Georgia rally where he said she would be a better governor than Republican Brian Kemp, the state's current leader.
